values.description: This indicator computes the n-period target downside deviation. The target downside deviation is defined as the root-mean-square, or RMS, of the deviations of the realized return’s underperformance from the target return where all returns above the target return are treated as underperformance of 0. Reference: https://www.cmegroup.com/education/files/rr-sortino-a-sharper-ratio.pdf
